name: imperishably
content:

in a way that lasts forever and does not become weaker with time or age: She has a huge collection of imperishably popular songs. It is one of those imperishably great moments in sport.
More examplesFewer examplesThe facts are recorded imperishably in the pages of human history, but the interpretation put upon them has changed.He remains the manager most imperishably linked to the club's glory days.His name is imperishably associated with this key battle in the Civil War.
